body_html:
Hi @wdirons
I think I my system the pip and pip3 is the same.

[root@Jingfeng_redhat ~]# which pip
/usr/bin/pip
[root@Jingfeng_redhat ~]# pip --version
pip 10.0.1 from /usr/lib/python3.4/site-packages/pip (python 3.4)
[root@Jingfeng_redhat ~]# which pip3
/usr/bin/pip3
[root@Jingfeng_redhat ~]# pip3 --version
pip 10.0.1 from /usr/lib/python3.4/site-packages/pip (python 3.4)

I install the same whl from pip3, but it cannot installed it into python3.4 site-packages directory

[root@Jingfeng_redhat ~]# cd /tmp/tensorflow_pkg
[root@Jingfeng_redhat tensorflow_pkg]# ls
tensorflow-1.9.0rc0-cp34-cp34m-linux_ppc64le.whl
[root@Jingfeng_redhat tensorflow_pkg]# pip3 install tensorflow-1.9.0rc0-cp34-cp34m-linux_ppc64le.whl 
Processing ./tensorflow-1.9.0rc0-cp34-cp34m-linux_ppc64le.whl
Requirement already satisfied: six>=1.10.0 in /usr/lib/python3.4/site-packages (from tensorflow==1.9.0rc0) (1.11.0)
Collecting absl-py>=0.1.6 (from tensorflow==1.9.0rc0)
Requirement already satisfied: grpcio>=1.8.6 in /usr/lib64/python3.4/site-packages (from tensorflow==1.9.0rc0) (1.13.0)
Collecting astor>=0.6.0 (from tensorflow==1.9.0rc0)
  Using cached https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/35/6b/11530768cac581a12952a2aad00e1526b89d242d0b9f59534ef6e6a1752f/astor-0.7.1-py2.py3-none-any.whl
Requirement already satisfied: wheel>=0.26 in /usr/lib/python3.4/site-packages (from tensorflow==1.9.0rc0) (0.31.1)
Requirement already satisfied: protobuf>=3.6.0 in /usr/lib/python3.4/site-packages (from tensorflow==1.9.0rc0) (3.6.0)
Collecting numpy>=1.13.3 (from tensorflow==1.9.0rc0)
Requirement already satisfied: termcolor>=1.1.0 in /usr/lib/python3.4/site-packages (from tensorflow==1.9.0rc0) (1.1.0)
Requirement already satisfied: setuptools<=39.1.0 in /usr/lib/python3.4/site-packages (from tensorflow==1.9.0rc0) (19.6.2)
Requirement already satisfied: gast>=0.2.0 in /usr/lib/python3.4/site-packages (from tensorflow==1.9.0rc0) (0.2.0)
Collecting tensorboard<1.9.0,>=1.8.0 (from tensorflow==1.9.0rc0)
  Using cached https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/59/a6/0ae6092b7542cfedba6b2a1c9b8dceaf278238c39484f3ba03b03f07803c/tensorboard-1.8.0-py3-none-any.whl
Requirement already satisfied: markdown>=2.6.8 in /usr/lib64/python3.4/site-packages (from tensorboard<1.9.0,>=1.8.0->tensorflow==1.9.0rc0) (2.6.11)
Requirement already satisfied: bleach==1.5.0 in /usr/lib/python3.4/site-packages (from tensorboard<1.9.0,>=1.8.0->tensorflow==1.9.0rc0) (1.5.0)
Requirement already satisfied: werkzeug>=0.11.10 in /usr/lib64/python3.4/site-packages (from tensorboard<1.9.0,>=1.8.0->tensorflow==1.9.0rc0) (0.14.1)
Requirement already satisfied: html5lib==0.9999999 in /usr/lib/python3.4/site-packages (from tensorboard<1.9.0,>=1.8.0->tensorflow==1.9.0rc0) (0.9999999)
notebook 5.5.0 has requirement jupyter-core>=4.4.0, but you'll have jupyter-core 4.3.0 which is incompatible.
Installing collected packages: absl-py, astor, numpy, tensorboard, tensorflow
  Found existing installation: numpy 1.10.4
Cannot uninstall 'numpy'. It is a distutils installed project and thus we cannot accurately determine which files belong to it which would lead to only a partial uninstall.
[root@Jingfeng_redhat tensorflow_pkg]# python3.4
Python 3.4.8 (default, Mar 23 2018, 10:06:54) 
[GCC 4.8.5 20150623 (Red Hat 4.8.5-16)] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import tensorflow as tf
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
ImportError: No module named 'tensorflow'
>>>

For above problem:

I need to firstly yum erase numpy
yum erase python34-numpy-f2py python34-numpy
pip3 install tensorflow-1.9.0rc0-cp34-cp34m-linux_ppc64le.whl

Then problem solved!

Thanks again for this help @wdirons

I think I my system the pip and pip3 is the same.
[root@Jingfeng_redhat ~]# which pip

yum erase python34-numpy-f2py python34-numpy
pip3 install tensorflow-1.9.0rc0-cp34-cp34m-linux_ppc64le.whl 
Then problem solved!
Thanks again for this help @wdirons
body:
Hi @wdirons 
I think I my system the pip and pip3 is the same. 

```
[root@Jingfeng_redhat ~]# which pip
/usr/bin/pip
[root@Jingfeng_redhat ~]# pip --version
pip 10.0.1 from /usr/lib/python3.4/site-packages/pip (python 3.4)
[root@Jingfeng_redhat ~]# which pip3
/usr/bin/pip3
[root@Jingfeng_redhat ~]# pip3 --version
pip 10.0.1 from /usr/lib/python3.4/site-packages/pip (python 3.4)
```

I install the same whl from pip3, but it cannot installed it into python3.4 site-packages directory

```
[root@Jingfeng_redhat ~]# cd /tmp/tensorflow_pkg
[root@Jingfeng_redhat tensorflow_pkg]# ls
tensorflow-1.9.0rc0-cp34-cp34m-linux_ppc64le.whl
[root@Jingfeng_redhat tensorflow_pkg]# pip3 install tensorflow-1.9.0rc0-cp34-cp34m-linux_ppc64le.whl 
Processing ./tensorflow-1.9.0rc0-cp34-cp34m-linux_ppc64le.whl
Requirement already satisfied: six>=1.10.0 in /usr/lib/python3.4/site-packages (from tensorflow==1.9.0rc0) (1.11.0)
Collecting absl-py>=0.1.6 (from tensorflow==1.9.0rc0)
Requirement already satisfied: grpcio>=1.8.6 in /usr/lib64/python3.4/site-packages (from tensorflow==1.9.0rc0) (1.13.0)
Collecting astor>=0.6.0 (from tensorflow==1.9.0rc0)
  Using cached https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/35/6b/11530768cac581a12952a2aad00e1526b89d242d0b9f59534ef6e6a1752f/astor-0.7.1-py2.py3-none-any.whl
Requirement already satisfied: wheel>=0.26 in /usr/lib/python3.4/site-packages (from tensorflow==1.9.0rc0) (0.31.1)
Requirement already satisfied: protobuf>=3.6.0 in /usr/lib/python3.4/site-packages (from tensorflow==1.9.0rc0) (3.6.0)
Collecting numpy>=1.13.3 (from tensorflow==1.9.0rc0)
Requirement already satisfied: termcolor>=1.1.0 in /usr/lib/python3.4/site-packages (from tensorflow==1.9.0rc0) (1.1.0)
Requirement already satisfied: setuptools<=39.1.0 in /usr/lib/python3.4/site-packages (from tensorflow==1.9.0rc0) (19.6.2)
Requirement already satisfied: gast>=0.2.0 in /usr/lib/python3.4/site-packages (from tensorflow==1.9.0rc0) (0.2.0)
Collecting tensorboard<1.9.0,>=1.8.0 (from tensorflow==1.9.0rc0)
  Using cached https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/59/a6/0ae6092b7542cfedba6b2a1c9b8dceaf278238c39484f3ba03b03f07803c/tensorboard-1.8.0-py3-none-any.whl
Requirement already satisfied: markdown>=2.6.8 in /usr/lib64/python3.4/site-packages (from tensorboard<1.9.0,>=1.8.0->tensorflow==1.9.0rc0) (2.6.11)
Requirement already satisfied: bleach==1.5.0 in /usr/lib/python3.4/site-packages (from tensorboard<1.9.0,>=1.8.0->tensorflow==1.9.0rc0) (1.5.0)
Requirement already satisfied: werkzeug>=0.11.10 in /usr/lib64/python3.4/site-packages (from tensorboard<1.9.0,>=1.8.0->tensorflow==1.9.0rc0) (0.14.1)
Requirement already satisfied: html5lib==0.9999999 in /usr/lib/python3.4/site-packages (from tensorboard<1.9.0,>=1.8.0->tensorflow==1.9.0rc0) (0.9999999)
notebook 5.5.0 has requirement jupyter-core>=4.4.0, but you'll have jupyter-core 4.3.0 which is incompatible.
Installing collected packages: absl-py, astor, numpy, tensorboard, tensorflow
  Found existing installation: numpy 1.10.4
Cannot uninstall 'numpy'. It is a distutils installed project and thus we cannot accurately determine which files belong to it which would lead to only a partial uninstall.
[root@Jingfeng_redhat tensorflow_pkg]# python3.4
Python 3.4.8 (default, Mar 23 2018, 10:06:54) 
[GCC 4.8.5 20150623 (Red Hat 4.8.5-16)] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import tensorflow as tf
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
ImportError: No module named 'tensorflow'
>>> 

```


For above problem: 

I need to firstly yum erase numpy
`yum erase python34-numpy-f2py python34-numpy`
`pip3 install tensorflow-1.9.0rc0-cp34-cp34m-linux_ppc64le.whl `

Then problem solved! 

Thanks again for this help @wdirons
